name: Hilton Bogota

reviews.text: The Hilton Bogota was a really pleasant surprise in my recent personal/business trip to Bogota. It's located right across the street from my company's offices so this is our standard hotel. I should mention that because of this relationship, I stayed in a room on the executive floor and had access to the hotel breakfast. But what made the place so worth while was the excellent staff -- attentive, helpful, always courteous. Their good English more than made up for my very bad Spanish.
reviews.title: Great hotel, wonderful service, convenient location

reviews.text: My room was a treat: spacious, thoughtfully designed, highly efficient. I especially appreciated the blackout blinds, which worked really well.
reviews.title: Neat, efficient and great pool; beats JW Marriot

reviews.text: I made less use of the gym than I would have liked, but I certainly appreciated that it's available 24 hours a day. While the equipment isn't quite comprehensive, it's much better than most hotel gyms and will give most everyone a good workout.
reviews.title: Modern and Excellent Service

reviews.text: Dinner in the main restaurant exceeded expectations -- a little expensive, but not terribly so given the quality of the food and service. However, unless you're super-exhausted I would recommend reserving that for a Sunday evening, when many of the area's other restaurants are closed.
reviews.title: Poor Quality for a Newly-Designed Hilton

reviews.text: The executive-suite breakfast was standard for its type: fruit, salads, bread, cereal, scrambled eggs (they're not set up to cook eggs to order). It's certainly a convenient but not terribly memorable. That said, there don't seem to be many other breakfast options right by the hotel so it's worth considering.
reviews.title: Good place for a business trip to Bogota

reviews.text: Hilton Bogota is enough comfortable for me as a hhonor gold member getting a free upgrade to the executive floor & lounge access.
reviews.title: Almost perfect with some exceptions...

reviews.text: Only some pities in this Hilton quality if I would mention were;
reviews.title: Comfortable very stylish rooms, great price

reviews.text: 1. No bathtub. (I think it could have been possible to install a bathtub if the bathroom layout had had 30cm more space. Closet space seems still enough if it's 30cm less.)
reviews.title: Excellent for business

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 2. No disposable or washable slippers even in an executive room. (there was at least one in the room at Embassy Suites Bogota)
reviews.title: Brilliant: great hotel, fabulous staff and outstanding value

reviews.text: 3. No partitions between bathroom and closet. Vapour will come into the closet during bething and clothes hung there can be wet.
reviews.title: Hilton Bogota

reviews.text: Excfellent rooms, with good walk-in wardrobes and bathrooms. Excellent desks in rooms and rooms are very arge. Superb & reliable Wi-fi. Very friendly and professional service. Great breakfast. 24hr gym. Absolutely no complaints. Definitely a business hotel (and a very good one by international standards) rather than a leisure notel. Well done Hilton Bogota..
reviews.title: Excellent business hotel

reviews.text: This was my first visit to Bogota and was not sure what to expect. However I was pleasantly surprised by how polite and friendly everyone is! The hotel is very central and has everything you would expect from a good Hilton. The staff are very friendly and offer great service and the rooms are spacious and comfortable. Whilst checking out I asked for a coffee as I had no time for breakfast and they quickly made me one 'to go' free of charge.
reviews.title: Friendly and central hotel.

reviews.text: I really liked this hotel. The room was bigger than I expected with a proper desk, seating area, big bed (v comfy) and a great bathroom. I liked the monsoon shower!
reviews.title: Really nice, clean, efficient. Will return.

reviews.text: The staff were all friendly and efficient and not intrusive at all. Coffee machine in the room which is replaced with two coffee servings daily. The maid service was excellent.
reviews.title: Good hotel, great service!

reviews.text: Some peple have complained about the location on the road but I found this convenient and traffic noise was never a problem in the room so the sound proofing is clearly effective!
reviews.title: Average Stay...

reviews.text: This was a good hotel, with nice modern rooms, good bathrooms and a lot of space. The view from my room was not that nice even though I was on the 11th floor. There is an executive lounge on the second floor, but that is not very special. The hotel does not have a lot of amenities but does the trick so is a good solid choice but don't expect anything out off the ordinary.
reviews.title: Good solid Hilton but a bit soulless

reviews.text: We chose the Hilton primarily because we wanted to earn more Hilton Honors points. In hindsight, the basis for the selection was probably somewhat misguided and the ordinary experience we had might have been predicted based on comparative reviews of the three leading international chain hotels in this part of Bogota, including the more impressive JW Marriott around the corner and the far better situated Sofitel in the heart of the Zona Rosa.
reviews.title: Just Ordinary

reviews.text: Despite being only one year old, some of the public areas of the hotel have a slightly tired feel already. The lobby is small, crowded and unsuitable for a casual business meeting or just relaxing with a cup of coffee or a drink. On the other hand, a year is more than enough time to work out the many kinks in service and appointments. For example, a room for two was prepared with one bathrobe and a second one was never brought. There were no slippers to go with the robe. Two complimentary bottles of water were in the room at check-in but never replaced. Sorry, but when you’re paying almost $300 a night with tax, the bottled water should be replaced daily. The A/C unit was noisy so we turned it off and dealt with the slight stuffiness in the room at night.
reviews.title: Corporate - but great
Gay friendly luxury in the heart of Bogota
reviews.text: But the biggest problems were in the Executive Lounge, where service at best was mediocre. One morning there were no eggs and there was a long wait for them to be replaced. The next morning, there were no eggs, orange juice, milk or bottled water. The excuse for the water was that they had run out. Obviously. In the whole hotel? No, only in the Lounge. Could someone bring bottled water from the restaurant or the bar? No, that water was their own inventory. The Lounge would not get more water until the mid-afternoon. Sorry again, when you’re paying top rates and staying on the executive floor, the executive lounge is supposed to be fully stocked at all times. If items are running short, the staff should notice that and order replacements in advance to avoid shortages. On top of that, the coffee machine in the Lounge had to be manually refilled frequently with – you guessed it – water and even then only spit out a small cup at a snail’s pace, creating more delays for guests.

Finally, for a new hotel, the lack of double paned windows made it difficult to sleep past the first of morning rush hour due to the intrusion of traffic noise, even with a room at the top of the hotel.
reviews.title: Great Stay

description: Hilton Bogotá is ideally located in the heart of Colombia's largest city and within walking distance from the vibrant dining and entertaining areas, the financial district - including shopping malls, theatres, museums and conveniently located just 25 minutes from El Dorado International - the city's only airport. This modern hotel features excellent facilities that are ideal for leisure and business guest alike; including a restaurant with direct street access, a sophisticated bar overlooking the pool, state-of-the-art fitness center, swimming pool and underground parking. What's more, this hotel is an ideal choice venue for meetings and groups, with close 10,000 sq. ft. of meeting space including 8 meeting rooms varying in size up to 1,100 sq. ft. and a main ballroom with 5,000 sq. ft. There is wireless internet access throughout the hotel.
